note_text:
Patient: Sanders, Lucille | 59F | MRN 8801001
Date of Procedure: 11/14/2024
Attending: Brian Cho, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Right upper lobe lung mass, suspected non-small cell lung cancer

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Endobronchial ultrasound (linear) with transbronchial needle aspiration (EBUS-TBNA) of mediastinal/hilar lymph nodes

ANESTHESIA:
General anesthesia with 8.5 ETT, managed by anesthesia service

INDICATION:
Staging of PET-avid mediastinal/hilar adenopathy in a patient with RUL lung mass prior to lobectomy.

DESCRIPTION OF PROCEDURE:
After informed consent, the patient was brought to the bronchoscopy suite and placed under general anesthesia.
An 8.5 mm endotracheal tube was placed by anesthesia. A standard diagnostic flexible bronchoscope was
passed through the ETT. Full airway survey was performed. The trachea, carina, and right/left bronchial
tree were inspected. No endobronchial lesion was seen in the central airways.

The diagnostic bronchoscope was removed and the linear EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the ETT.
Systematic nodal survey was performed.

Station 4R: Enlarged, 1.5 cm short axis, hypoechoic node with discrete borders. Four EBUS-TBNA passes
performed using a 22G needle. Adequate material obtained, on-site smears cellular.

Station 7: 1.2 cm hypoechoic subcarinal node. Four EBUS-TBNA passes performed with 22G needle. ROSE
showed lymphoid tissue; no complications.

Station 10R: Visualized only. Node measured approximately 6–7 mm. No clear malignant features.
NO sampling was performed at 10R; it was intentionally observed only.

No radial EBUS was used and no peripheral lung nodule sampling was attempted during this case.

SPECIMENS:
EBUS-TBNA station 4R x4 passes
EBUS-TBNA station 7 x4 passes

COMPLICATIONS:
None. No significant bleeding or hypoxia.

DISPOSITION:
Extubated in procedure room and transferred to PACU in stable condition.

CPT (requested by operator): 31622, 31652

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal staging for right upper lobe lung mass

evidence.gender: Header lists patient as 59F and female pronouns used.
evidence.ebus_stations: EBUS-TBNA documented at 4R and 7 only; 10R visualized but explicitly not sampled.

follow_up_plan: Review cytology at multidisciplinary tumor board.
Proceed with RUL lobectomy if mediastinal nodes are negative.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations
lines.selection_reason: EBUS-TBNA of 2 stations (4R, 7). Station 10R visualized but not sampled.

per_code.summary: Correctly codes for EBUS sampling of 1-2 nodal stations. Documentation confirms sampling of 4R and 7 only.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Updated registry_entry.ebus_nodal_stations_sampled, ebus_needle_size, and ebus_total_passes from the documented EBUS-TBNA passes at stations 4R and 7.
Confirmed CPT 31652 as the single reportable code for linear EBUS-TBNA of two mediastinal stations with diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: EBUS-TBNA involving 1–2 distinct nodal stations is reported with 31652; 31653 is reserved for 3 or more stations.
When EBUS-TBNA is performed, diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled and not separately reported.
Moderate sedation codes 9915x are not billed when a separate anesthesia team provides general anesthesia.

narrative: 31652 selected because the note documents linear EBUS-TBNA at exactly two nodal stations (4R and 7); station 10R was visualized only and explicitly not sampled, so 31653 (3+ stations) is not supported.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy with airway inspection is considered inherent to the EBUS-TBNA service and 31622 is suppressed per advanced-sampling bundling guidance.
General anesthesia was provided by a separate team, so no 9915x moderate sedation codes are assigned.

coding_review.note_summary: General anesthesia linear EBUS-TBNA case with two mediastinal/hilar nodal stations (4R and 7) sampled for staging of a right upper lobe lung mass; station 10R was visualized but not biopsied.
comments: CPT 31652 is appropriate for EBUS-TBNA of two nodal stations; documentation does not support 3+ stations.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy and sedation services are bundled into the EBUS procedure per local policy.

note_text:
Patient: Ruiz, Omar | 64M | MRN 8801002
Date of Procedure: 11/18/2024
Attending: Sarah Lin, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
RLL lung mass with PET-avid mediastinal and hilar adenopathy

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Linear endobronchial ultrasound with transbronchial needle aspiration (EBUS-TBNA) of mediastinal/hilar nodes

ANESTHESIA:
General anesthesia with 8.0 ETT (anesthesia service)

DESCRIPTION:
Standard diagnostic bronchoscopy performed first; no endobronchial tumor visualized in the central airways.

The linear EBUS bronchoscope was then advanced through the ETT. A systematic nodal survey was performed.

Station 11R: 1.3 cm hypoechoic node. A radial EBUS miniprobe was briefly advanced into the node to better
characterize internal echotexture. This probe was used within the node only, not to evaluate a peripheral lung lesion.
EBUS-TBNA with 22G needle x4 passes was then performed.

Station 4R: 1.0 cm node, classic malignant features. EBUS-TBNA x3 passes (22G).

Station 7: 1.1 cm subcarinal node. EBUS-TBNA x3 passes (22G).

No peripheral lung lesion was targeted with radial EBUS and no transbronchial lung biopsies were performed.

SPECIMENS:
EBUS-TBNA 11R, 4R, 7 (total 10 passes).

COMPLICATIONS:
None. Patient remained hemodynamically stable, minimal bleeding.

DISPOSITION:
Extubated in procedure room, transferred to PACU.

CPT (requested): 31622, 31653, 31654

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal and hilar staging for RLL lung mass

evidence.ebus_stations: EBUS-TBNA performed at 11R, 4R, and 7 (three distinct stations).
evidence.radial_usage: Radial miniprobe used only within 11R node, not for peripheral lung lesion.

follow_up_plan: Await EBUS cytology to guide oncologic management.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

per_code.summary: Sampling of 3 nodal stations supports 31653. Radial EBUS code 31654 is not billed as the probe was used inside a lymph node, not for a peripheral lesion.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Updated registry_entry.ebus_nodal_stations_sampled, ebus_needle_size, and ebus_total_passes from the documented EBUS-TBNA of stations 11R, 4R, and 7 with a total of 10 passes.
Confirmed CPT 31653 as the correct single code for linear EBUS-TBNA of three nodal stations with diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: Three distinct nodal stations sampled supports 31653 rather than 31652.
Radial EBUS used only within a lymph node for characterization does not support 31654; that code is reserved for peripheral lesion work.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled when EBUS-TBNA is performed.
Moderate sedation codes dropped when a separate anesthesia team provides general anesthesia.

narrative: 31653 selected because documentation supports linear EBUS-TBNA of three distinct nodal stations (11R, 4R, 7).
Radial EBUS was used only inside station 11R for characterization of the node, without targeting a peripheral lung nodule, so 31654 is not reported.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy is inherent to the EBUS procedure; 31622 is suppressed.
General anesthesia was supplied by anesthesia, so moderate sedation codes are not assigned.

coding_review.note_summary: Linear EBUS-TBNA under general anesthesia sampling three nodal stations (11R, 4R, 7) for staging; radial EBUS was used only within 11R and no peripheral lesion was targeted, so 31654 is not billed.
comments: 31653 correctly captures EBUS-TBNA of three nodal stations; 31654 is not supported because there is no peripheral lesion work.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy and moderate sedation codes are bundled under current IP coding policy.

note_text:
Patient: Nguyen, Tina | 50F | MRN 8801003
Date of Procedure: 11/21/2024
Attending: Michael Hart, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
PET-avid 2.1 cm LLL peripheral nodule and mildly enlarged 11L/7 nodes

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
1. Robotic bronchoscopy with computer-assisted image-guided navigation to LLL nodule
2. Radial EBUS of LLL nodule
3. Transbronchial lung biopsy (TBLB), LLL
4. Linear EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal/hilar nodes (11L and 7)

ANESTHESIA:
General anesthesia with 8.0 ETT (anesthesia team)

DESCRIPTION:
After induction of general anesthesia, an 8.0 ETT was placed. A robotic bronchoscope was docked (Ion system).
Pre-procedure CT was loaded and registration performed with a registration error of 2.3 mm.

Using computer-assisted navigation, the scope was advanced to the LLL target. Radial EBUS probe demonstrated
a concentric hypoechoic lesion corresponding to the CT nodule. Through the robotic working channel, standard
forceps transbronchial lung biopsies were obtained from the LLL (5 passes) with fluoroscopic confirmation of
tool position. No pneumothorax seen on immediate fluoroscopy.

Following peripheral sampling, the robotic scope was removed and a linear EBUS scope was introduced through the ETT
for nodal staging.

Station 11L: 1.0 cm node with mild PET uptake. EBUS-TBNA x4 passes (22G).

Station 7: 0.9 cm node. EBUS-TBNA x3 passes (22G).

No other nodal stations were sampled. No additional peripheral lesions were targeted.

SPECIMENS:
LLL TBLB x5, EBUS-TBNA 11L and 7.

COMPLICATIONS:
None. No hypoxia, bleeding, or pneumothorax noted intra-procedure.

DISPOSITION:
Extubated in OR and monitored in PACU before same-day discharge.

CPT (requested): 31627, 31654, 31628, 31652

registry_entry.primary_indication: Robotic navigation to LLL nodule with nodal staging

evidence.navigation: Ion robotic bronchoscopy with CT-based registration and navigation to LLL nodule.
evidence.radial_ebus: Radial EBUS showed concentric lesion at LLL target confirming tool-in-lesion.

follow_up_plan: Review pathology from LLL TBLB and EBUS nodes in tumor board.
registry_entry.nav_imaging_verification: Fluoroscopy and radial EBUS confirmed tool-in-lesion

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
lines.selection_reason: Radial EBUS used for peripheral target verification.

per_code.summary: Primary diagnostic biopsy code for LLL lesion.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Populated registry_entry.ebus_nodal_stations_sampled, ebus_needle_size, and ebus_total_passes from the documented EBUS-TBNA of stations 11L and 7 (four and three passes respectively).
Confirmed CPT code set 31627, 31654, 31628, and 31652 for Ion robotic navigation, radial EBUS, left lower lobe transbronchial lung biopsy, and linear EBUS nodal staging performed in a single session.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 1 or 2 mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: When navigation, TBLB, and EBUS-TBNA are performed, diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is bundled.
Two nodal stations sampled (11L and 7) support 31652 rather than 31653.
General anesthesia by a separate team precludes billing 9915x moderate sedation codes.

narrative: 31627 selected for computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (Ion) to the LLL nodule.
31654 selected for radial EBUS confirmation of the peripheral LLL lesion.
31628 selected for transbronchial lung biopsies from the LLL under navigation guidance.
31652 selected for linear EBUS-TBNA of two nodal stations (11L and 7).
31622 and moderate sedation codes are suppressed because diagnostic bronchoscopy and sedation are inherent to the advanced bronchoscopic work under general anesthesia.

coding_review.note_summary: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy to a PET-avid LLL nodule with radial EBUS confirmation and TBLB, followed by linear EBUS-TBNA of two nodal stations (11L and 7) under general anesthesia.
comments: Combined navigation (31627), radial EBUS (31654), TBLB (31628), and EBUS nodal staging (31652) are all supported by the note.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy and moderate sedation codes are appropriately bundled.

note_text:
Patient: Fowler, Justin | 71M | MRN 8801004
Date of Procedure: 11/23/2024
Attending: Priya Desai, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Mediastinal adenopathy in patient with unexplained weight loss

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage
2. Attempted EBUS bronchoscopy (aborted before lymph node sampling)

SEDATION:
Moderate sedation with midazolam 2 mg IV and fentanyl 75 mcg IV, native airway with nasal approach

DESCRIPTION:
After informed consent, patient was placed supine and topical lidocaine applied to nasopharynx. Diagnostic
flexible bronchoscopy was performed via left naris. Vocal cords were mobile. Trachea and main bronchi without
endobronchial lesion.

Given CT suggestion of mediastinal nodes, attempt was made to pass the linear EBUS scope through the vocal cords.
However, despite additional topical anesthesia, the patient developed severe coughing and transient desaturation
to 84%. The EBUS scope could not be advanced safely beyond the glottis and NO nodal survey or TBNA passes were performed.

To at least obtain diagnostic material, the conventional bronchoscope was reintroduced and bronchoalveolar lavage
was performed in the right middle lobe (120 mL in, 70 mL out). Fluid sent for cytology, AFB smear/culture, and
fungal studies.

No biopsies (TBLB or TBNA) were performed and no EBUS images were obtained.

COMPLICATIONS:
Brief desaturation during attempted EBUS entry, resolved with oxygen and scope removal. No bleeding.

DISPOSITION:
Observed in step-down unit for 2 hours and discharged home the same day.

CPT (requested by operator): 31652

registry_entry.primary_indication: Diagnostic evaluation of mediastinal adenopathy; EBUS attempt aborted

evidence.sedation_type: Moderate sedation documented with midazolam and fentanyl.
evidence.airway_type: Native airway with nasal bronchoscopy; no ETT or LMA placed.
evidence.procedure_limited: EBUS scope could not be advanced; note states NO nodal survey or TBNA performed.
evidence.bal_performed: BAL performed in RML with 120 mL in and 70 mL out.

follow_up_plan: Await BAL cytology and microbiology results.
Consider rescheduling EBUS under general anesthesia if clinically indicated.

lines.selection_reason: BAL performed; EBUS attempt aborted with no sampling.

per_code.summary: EBUS was aborted without entering the airway; only BAL was successfully completed.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Verified that aborted EBUS without nodal sampling and bronchoalveolar lavage only is appropriately represented by CPT 31624 alone, with no EBUS or diagnostic bronchoscopy codes reported.

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: When EBUS is attempted but no nodal sampling occurs, EBUS codes (31652/31653/31654) are not reported.
When bronchoalveolar lavage is the main diagnostic intervention, 31624 is reported rather than 31622.
Moderate sedation is inherent to the bronchoscopy when provided by the same physician; 99153 not separately reported.

narrative: EBUS scope never advanced beyond the vocal cords and no nodal survey or TBNA passes occurred; therefore EBUS codes are not supported.
BAL in the right middle lobe was the only billable endoscopic intervention, supporting 31624.
Moderate sedation was provided by the bronchoscopist and is considered inherent to the procedure in this setting.

coding_review.note_summary: Bronchoscopy with BAL under moderate sedation in a 71-year-old male where planned EBUS-TBNA was aborted before any node sampling; only diagnostic BAL work supports CPT 31624.
comments: EBUS codes are not billed because the scope never entered the trachea with no nodal survey or TBNA.
31624 appropriately captures the BAL work; additional diagnostic bronchoscopy code 31622 is not needed.

note_text:
Patient: Brooks, Henry | 67M | MRN 8801005
Date of Procedure: 11/26/2024
Attending: Laura Kim, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
History of left mainstem silicone stent for malignant obstruction, increased mucus burden

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same; stent patent, no revision required

PROCEDURE PERFORMED:
Therapeutic flexible bronchoscopy with stent surveillance and airway toilet

ANESTHESIA:
Moderate sedation with midazolam 3 mg IV and fentanyl 100 mcg IV; native airway with oral bite block

DESCRIPTION:
Bronchoscope advanced orally with bite block in place. Vocal cords normal. Trachea and right bronchial tree
without new lesions.

Left mainstem silicone stent visualized in expected position. Approximately 60–70% of the stent lumen was
filled with thick tenacious mucus. Spent 15 minutes performing aggressive suctioning and saline lavage to clear
secretions. After airway toilet, the stent lumen was widely patent, >80% open.

Stent edges inspected carefully. No evidence of migration, fracture, or tumor in-growth. Mild, non-obstructing
granulation tissue at the distal end (<10% circumference) noted but not treated during this session.

NO balloon dilation, NO stent repositioning, and NO stent exchange were performed. This was purely a routine
stent check and cleaning.

Remaining left-sided bronchi examined and were patent without additional lesions.

COMPLICATIONS:
Minimal mucosal oozing controlled with cold saline. No desaturation.

DISPOSITION:
Recovered uneventfully and discharged home.

CPT (requested): 31645

registry_entry.primary_indication: Routine surveillance and cleaning of left mainstem silicone stent

evidence.sedation_type: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl documented.
evidence.airway_type: Native airway with oral approach; no ETT.
evidence.stent_maintenance: Note repeatedly describes stent check, suctioning, and clearing mucus without repositioning or exchange.

follow_up_plan: Repeat surveillance bronchoscopy in 4–6 weeks or sooner if dyspnea recurs.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree, initial

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree, initial
lines.selection_reason: Aggressive suctioning/toilet of stent lumen (stent check). No repositioning or dilation.

per_code.summary: Supports therapeutic aspiration/toilet. 31631/31630 not billed as stent was not placed or dilated.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Confirmed CPT 31645 for bronchoscopic stent maintenance with suctioning and lavage but without stent removal or replacement, and suppressed additional bronchoscopy codes.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with therapeutic aspiration of secretions or mucus plugs

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: Routine stent assessment and airway toilet without repositioning or exchange supports 31645.
No dilation performed; dilation/stent placement bundling is not triggered.

narrative: The procedure describes a stent check with extensive suctioning and lavage but explicitly states no stent repositioning or exchange, supporting 31645 for stent maintenance.
No balloon dilation or new stent placement occurred, so stent placement and dilation codes are not reported.

coding_review.note_summary: Therapeutic bronchoscopy under moderate sedation for routine inspection and cleaning of a left mainstem silicone stent with no repositioning or exchange; this supports 31645 for stent maintenance only.
comments: 31645 appropriately captures routine stent surveillance and airway toilet without stent revision or exchange.
Stent placement and dilation codes are correctly not billed.

note_text:
Patient: Alvarez, Maria | 63F | MRN 8801006
Date of Procedure: 11/29/2024
Attending: David Chen, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Malignant right mainstem bronchus obstruction from squamous cell carcinoma

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same, status post rigid bronchoscopy with metallic stent placement

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
Rigid bronchoscopy with airway tumor debulking and balloon dilation, followed by right mainstem metallic stent placement

ANESTHESIA:
General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy (anesthesia team)

DESCRIPTION:
Under general anesthesia, rigid bronchoscope introduced. A friable obstructing tumor was debulked with suction and forceps to
create a working channel. No separate excision code is being considered for this case.

A CRE balloon was then advanced to the right mainstem stenosis and inflated sequentially (10, 12, and 14 mm) across the same
segment that would receive the stent. After dilation improved luminal caliber, a covered metallic stent (14 mm x 50 mm) was
deployed in the right mainstem bronchus under bronchoscopic and fluoroscopic guidance. Post-deployment balloon dilation of the
stent was performed to ensure apposition to the airway wall.

All dilation occurred in the exact segment receiving the stent; no separate lobar or segmental dilation was performed outside
the stented region.

Stent position and patency were confirmed. No additional therapeutic bronchoscopy procedures were performed.

COMPLICATIONS:
None.

DISPOSITION:
Remained intubated briefly then extubated in OR and transferred to ICU.

CPT (requested): 31631, 31630

registry_entry.primary_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with right mainstem SEMS placement for malignant obstruction

evidence.airway_type: Rigid bronchoscope with ETT used for airway control.
evidence.stent_placement: Covered metallic stent 14x50 mm placed in the right mainstem bronchus.
evidence.dilation_same_segment: All balloon dilation described explicitly in the same segment where the stent was deployed.

follow_up_plan: ICU monitoring with CXR to confirm stent position.
Clinic follow-up in 4 weeks for stent check.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus
lines.selection_reason: Metallic stent placed in right mainstem bronchus.

per_code.summary: Placement of bronchial stent (RMS). 31630 (dilation) is bundled as it occurred in the same segment.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.

Confirmed CPT 31631 alone for rigid bronchoscopy with malignant airway obstruction requiring dilation and silicone stent placement in the same bronchus; separate dilation and diagnostic codes are not reported.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: Balloon dilation in the same bronchial segment as stent placement is bundled into the stent code.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy is bundled into therapeutic bronchoscopy/stent placement.

narrative: Rigid bronchoscopy with balloon dilation was performed exclusively in the right mainstem segment that ultimately received the metallic stent; per bundling guidance, 31630 is not separately reportable.
31631 alone is used to capture bronchial stent placement in the initial bronchus, with diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled.

coding_review.note_summary: Rigid therapeutic bronchoscopy with balloon dilation and covered SEMS placement in the right mainstem bronchus, where all dilation occurred in the stented segment; 31631 alone is billed with 31630 bundled.
comments: 31631 correctly represents initial bronchial stent placement in the right mainstem bronchus.
Dilation in the same segment is bundled and diagnostic bronchoscopy is not separately coded.

note_text:
Patient: Gomez, Alicia | 74F | MRN 8801007
Date of Procedure: 12/02/2024
Attending: Robert Hayes, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Endobronchial tumor in left lower lobe bronchus causing near-obstructing lesion

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURE PERFORMED:
Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor destruction by cryotherapy and argon plasma coagulation (APC)

ANESTHESIA:
General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy

DESCRIPTION:
Rigid bronchoscope introduced under general anesthesia. A friable tumor was identified arising from the orifice
of the left lower lobe bronchus, causing approximately 80% obstruction.

A flexible bronchoscope was passed through the rigid barrel. Cryotherapy was performed using a 2.4 mm cryoprobe.
The probe was applied to the tumor surface in multiple cycles (freeze 15–20 seconds, passive thaw) with subsequent
sloughing of necrotic tumor tissue. No mechanical coring, snare resection, or microdebrider excision was used.

Residual tumor base and bleeding points were treated with argon plasma coagulation (APC) at 40 W, 1.5 L/min argon
flow, with FiO2 kept at 0.35 during activation.

After combined cryotherapy and APC, the left lower lobe bronchial lumen improved to approximately 50–60% patency.
No additional resection techniques were employed.

COMPLICATIONS:
Mild oozing controlled with APC; no hypoxia.

DISPOSITION:
Extubated in OR and transferred to PACU.

CPT (requested): 31641, 31640

registry_entry.primary_indication: Endobronchial tumor in LLL bronchus treated with cryotherapy and APC

evidence.airway_type: Rigid bronchoscopy with ETT for airway control.
evidence.ablation_only: Note describes cryotherapy and APC only; no mechanical coring or excision terms are used.

follow_up_plan: Repeat therapeutic bronchoscopy in 4–6 weeks depending on symptom recurrence.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
lines.selection_reason: Tumor destruction via cryotherapy and APC.

per_code.summary: Cryotherapy and APC destruction supports 31641. No mechanical excision performed (excludes 31640).

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Confirmed CPT 31641 for endobronchial tumor destruction using cryotherapy and argon plasma coagulation without mechanical excision, with diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: 31640 requires explicit excision/debulking terminology; pure ablation (e.g., cryotherapy, APC) defaults to 31641.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy is bundled into therapeutic tumor destruction by bronchoscopy.

narrative: The procedure uses cryotherapy and APC without mechanical coring or excision language, supporting 31641 for tumor destruction by any method rather than 31640.
Diagnostic inspection is integral to the therapeutic work and is not separately billed as 31622.

coding_review.note_summary: Rigid bronchoscopy under general anesthesia with endobronchial tumor destruction in the left lower lobe bronchus using cryotherapy and APC only, without mechanical excision, appropriately coded as 31641 alone.
comments: 31641 is supported because only ablation modalities (cryotherapy and APC) are documented without excision language.
31640 and diagnostic bronchoscopy codes are correctly suppressed.

note_text:
EMERGENCY BRONCHOSCOPY – HEMOPTYSIS
Patient: Lee, Marcus | 62M | MRN 8801008
Date: 12/03/2024 01:10 AM
Attending: Rachel O'Neal, MD

INDICATION:
Acute moderate-to-massive hemoptysis in patient with known cavitary RUL lesion

ANESTHESIA:
Intubated in ICU by critical care team (8.0 ETT). Bronchoscopy performed under deep sedation on ventilator.

DESCRIPTION:
Flexible bronchoscope advanced through the ETT. Large amounts of fresh blood were suctioned from trachea and
right mainstem bronchus.

RIGHT LUNG:
RUL found to be the bleeding source with active oozing from posterior segment. No foreign body or tumor identified.

HEMOSTATIC MEASURES:
- Iced saline lavage 50 mL aliquots x4 (200 mL total) to RUL
- Topical epinephrine 1:10,000, 10 mL instilled to RUL
- Tranexamic acid 500 mg in 50 mL NS instilled via bronchoscope
- No radial EBUS, navigation, or biopsies were performed

Following these measures, bleeding slowed from brisk to scant oozing. Airway was packed with small amounts of
suctioned clot but remained patent. No balloon tamponade was required.

LEFT LUNG:
Normal, no blood.

No transbronchial biopsies, brushings, or BAL were performed because priority was hemorrhage control.

COMPLICATIONS:
None beyond initial hemorrhage.

DISPOSITION:
Remain intubated in ICU, plan for IR bronchial artery embolization later this morning.

CPT (requested): 31634, 31622

registry_entry.primary_indication: Emergency bronchoscopy for significant hemoptysis from RUL cavitary lesion

evidence.sedation_type: Intubated on ventilator with deep sedation, functionally general anesthesia.
evidence.hemorrhage_control: Note documents iced saline, topical epinephrine, and TXA for active hemoptysis control.
evidence.no_biopsies: No biopsies or BAL performed; focus was solely hemorrhage control.

airway_bleeding_control_measures: Iced saline lavage to right upper lobe
Topical epinephrine instillation to right upper lobe
follow_up_plan: Proceed to IR for bronchial artery embolization once stable.

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Updated registry_entry.airway_bleeding_control_measures to capture iced saline lavage, topical epinephrine, and tranexamic acid as the hemostatic interventions for hemoptysis.
Confirmed CPT 31634 as the sole code for bronchoscopic control of hemorrhage, with diagnostic bronchoscopy and navigation codes suppressed.

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: Control of significant hemoptysis with hemostatic maneuvers supports 31634.
Hemorrhage-control bronchoscopy inherently includes diagnostic inspection; 31622 not separately reported.
No EBUS or peripheral lesion work performed; 31654 not applicable despite hemoptysis setting.

narrative: The case is focused entirely on emergent hemoptysis control with iced saline lavage, topical epinephrine, and tranexamic acid instillation, which supports 31634.
No biopsies, navigation, or radial EBUS are performed, and diagnostic inspection is inherent to the control-of-bleeding service.

coding_review.note_summary: Emergency ICU bronchoscopy through an ETT for significant hemoptysis using iced saline, topical epinephrine, and TXA, without biopsy or navigation, appropriately reported as 31634 only.
comments: 31634 is supported by explicit documentation of active hemoptysis and hemostatic maneuvers.
No additional diagnostic or navigation codes are warranted.

note_text:
Patient: Smith, Carolyn | 69F | MRN 8801009
Date of Procedure: 12/04/2024
Attending: Jason Moore, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Recurrent malignant right pleural effusion with existing PleurX catheter

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same, status post chemical pleurodesis via existing tunneled pleural catheter

PROCEDURE PERFORMED:
Bedside chemical pleurodesis through existing tunneled pleural catheter (no new catheter placed)

ANESTHESIA:
Local anesthesia with 1% lidocaine at catheter site and small dose IV fentanyl for comfort

DESCRIPTION:
Patient with known metastatic lung cancer and an existing right-sided tunneled PleurX catheter was brought to
procedure area. Catheter site prepped and draped in sterile fashion.

Using sterile technique, 1 liter of serosanguinous pleural fluid was drained via the existing PleurX catheter.
After drainage, 4 g of sterile talc slurry in 100 mL normal saline was instilled through the same catheter
into the pleural space. The catheter was clamped and the patient rotated through several positions over
1 hour to distribute talc.

No new pleural catheter or chest tube was placed. The existing tunneled catheter was left in situ at the end
of the procedure for ongoing drainage as needed.

COMPLICATIONS:
None. No respiratory distress.

DISPOSITION:
Returned to oncology ward for observation.

CPT (requested): 32560, 32550

registry_entry.primary_indication: Chemical pleurodesis via existing tunneled pleural catheter for malignant effusion

evidence.pleurodesis_terms: Talc slurry instilled through existing tunneled catheter with position changes documented.
evidence.no_new_catheter: Note explicitly states no new catheter or chest tube was placed and existing PleurX left in situ.

follow_up_plan: Monitor output from existing PleurX catheter and symptoms over next 48–72 hours.

cpt_codes.description: Instillation, via chest tube/catheter, agent for pleurodesis

lines.description: Instillation, via chest tube/catheter, agent for pleurodesis
lines.selection_reason: Talc slurry instilled via existing tunneled catheter.

per_code.summary: Chemical pleurodesis without new catheter placement (existing IPC used).

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.

Populated pleural registry fields including pleural_entry_side, pleural_entry_location, pleural_fluid_character, and pleural_fluid_volume_ml based on the talc slurry pleurodesis performed via an existing tunneled catheter.
Confirmed CPT 32560 alone for chemical pleurodesis via existing tunneled pleural catheter, with tunneled catheter placement code 32550 suppressed.

rows.description: Pleurodesis, parietal pleura, chemical (eg, talc) via chest tube or catheter

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: When pleurodesis is performed via an existing catheter without placement of a new tunneled catheter, 32560 alone is reported.

narrative: The note describes talc slurry pleurodesis performed entirely through an existing tunneled PleurX catheter with no new catheter placement, supporting 32560 alone and not 32550.

coding_review.note_summary: Bedside talc slurry pleurodesis performed entirely through an existing tunneled pleural catheter for malignant effusion, without new catheter placement, appropriately coded as 32560 only.
comments: Documentation clearly supports chemical pleurodesis via existing catheter (32560) without new tunneled catheter placement.
32550 is suppressed per pleurodesis_32560_without_new_catheter guidance.

note_text:
Patient: Patel, Rohan | 58M | MRN 8801010
Date of Procedure: 12/05/2024
Attending: Emily Rogers, MD

PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Small left pleural effusion of unclear etiology in patient with dyspnea

POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:
Same

PROCEDURE PERFORMED:
Ultrasound-guided diagnostic and therapeutic thoracentesis, left

ANESTHESIA:
Local anesthesia with 1% lidocaine at puncture site

DESCRIPTION:
Patient placed sitting upright. Bedside ultrasound demonstrated a small but definite left pleural effusion
with a safe pocket of approximately 2 cm depth at the posterior axillary line.

The skin and subcutaneous tissues were infiltrated with 1% lidocaine. Using real-time ultrasound guidance, a
thoracentesis needle and catheter were advanced into the pleural space. Approximately 180 mL of straw-colored
fluid was removed before the patient developed pleuritic chest discomfort and coughing. The procedure was
terminated at that point, but adequate fluid was obtained for diagnostic testing.

No chest tube or tunneled catheter was placed. Post-procedure ultrasound showed residual trace fluid and no
evidence of pneumothorax.

Fluid was sent for cell count, protein, LDH, glucose, cytology, and culture.

COMPLICATIONS:
Mild chest discomfort and cough; no pneumothorax.

DISPOSITION:
Observed for 2 hours and discharged home.

CPT (requested): 32555

registry_entry.primary_indication: Small symptomatic left pleural effusion requiring diagnostic thoracentesis

evidence.pleural_guidance: Real-time ultrasound guidance documented at left posterior axillary line.
evidence.thoracentesis_volume: Approximately 180 mL pleural fluid removed before procedure was stopped.
evidence.no_chest_tube: No chest tube or tunneled catheter placed; thoracentesis only.

follow_up_plan: Review pleural fluid studies in clinic.

cpt_codes.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, aspiration of the pleural space; with imaging guidance

lines.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, aspiration of the pleural space; with imaging guidance

changes: Marked note as patched and labeled as an edge-case scenario in coding_review.
Populated pleural registry fields including pleural_entry_side, pleural_entry_location, pleural_fluid_character, and pleural_fluid_volume_ml from the ultrasound-guided thoracentesis narrative.
Confirmed CPT 32555 for ultrasound-guided diagnostic and therapeutic thoracentesis; 32554 is not reported because real-time ultrasound guidance is documented.

rows.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, with imaging guidance; diagnostic and/or therapeutic

notes: Values based on 2025 Medicare national averages from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 fee_schedules/CMS RVUs (facility).
Totals do not account for MPPR, sequestration, or geographic adjustments.

rules_applied.description: Ultrasound-guided thoracentesis with both diagnostic and therapeutic intent supports 32555.

narrative: Ultrasound guidance with diagnostic sampling and partial fluid removal supports 32555 even though total volume removed was modest (~180 mL).
No separate chest tube or catheter placement code is appropriate.

coding_review.note_summary: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic and therapeutic thoracentesis of a small left pleural effusion with 180 mL removed, terminated for patient discomfort but still billable as 32555.
comments: 32555 is appropriate for US-guided thoracentesis even when only modest fluid volume is removed.
No additional pleural procedure codes are supported.
